section.text: *NOTE: This section was created by emergency legislation that will expire on December 29, 2022.*
section.heading: Migrant services and supports.

para.text: The Mayor may establish an office and administer programs to provide time-limited services and supports to recent immigrants to the United States, including the following services and supports:
Temporary shelter, which may be provided in a congregate setting;
Cash assistance for food and other necessities, transportation, relocation, and other identified needs; and
Social and legal services and referrals to external social and legal service programs and providers.

section.codify:annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of § 4-773.01, see § 101 of Migrant Services and Supports Emergency Amendment Act of 2022 (D.C. Act 24-553, Sept. 30, 2022, 0 DCR 0).
For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 101 of Migrant Services and Supports Emergency Amendment Act of 2022 (D.C. Act 24-553, Sept. 30, 2022, 0 DCR 0).
